_comments.batch_size: Typical range: 1-128 (computational parameter, not 6G standard). Higher values improve throughput but increase memory usage. For 6G simulations, typically 4-32 depending on system resources.
_comments.fft_size: 6G standard range: 512-16384 (must be power of 2). 5G max: 4096, 6G extends to 8192-16384 for wider bandwidths. Typical values: 512, 1024, 2048, 4096, 8192. Larger values provide better frequency resolution but increase computational complexity.
_comments.num_bs_ant: 6G massive MIMO range: 32-4096 antennas. 5G deployments: 64-256, 6G XL-MIMO: 128-256, Giga-MIMO research: up to 4096. Typical smart factory deployments: 32-256. More antennas enable spatial multiplexing and beamforming.
_comments.num_ut: 6G standard range: 8-256 user terminals per cell. Limited by min(N_BS, N_UT_total) for spatial multiplexing. Smart factory scenarios: 8-64 UTs typical. 6G supports 10 million devices/km² (10x improvement over 5G).
_comments.num_ut_ant: 6G standard range: 2-8 antennas per user terminal. 5G mobile devices: 1-4 antennas, 6G IoT devices: 2-8 antennas. More antennas enable MIMO transmission but increase device complexity and power consumption.
_comments.num_ofdm_symbols: 3GPP standard: 14 symbols per slot (normal CP in 5G/6G). Extended CP: 12 symbols. Each symbol duration T_sym = 1/Δf + T_CP, where Δf is subcarrier spacing (15-960 kHz for 6G, up to 3840 kHz for sub-THz).
